info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 28 at 10:54AM MDT until September 28 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.
* WHERE...Portions of central and southeast New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, Eastern Lincoln County. In southeast New Mexico, Chaves County Plains and Southwest Chaves County.
* WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall rates between one-half and one inch per hour along with repeated rounds of storms may lead to flash flooding in Chaves County and eastern Lincoln County, including Roswell and Hagerman. The strongest storms are most likely to occur this afternoon. Storm motion will be southwest to northeast. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County
